column2: WYOMING DMV DRIVING TEST
column6: WY

column2: Question Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. This road sign means:
column6: Railroad Crossing

column2: 2. A steady yellow light means:
column6: Be prepared to go. The light will soon be green.
column8: Be prepared to stop for the red light.

column2: 3. If you miss your exit on a freeway, do NOT:
column6: get back on the freeway in the opposite direction and return to the exit you want.
column8: continue on the freeway and find an alternative route.

column2: 4. When driving in snow, you should:
column4: slowly increase your speed for better traction.
column6: make speed and directional changes more gradually.
column8: use your cruise control if possible.

column2: 5. When driving in rainy weather, you should:
column6: drive in low gear.

column2: 6. This sign is a warning that you are approaching:
column6: a railroad crossing.

column2: 7. This road sign means:
column6: Stop

column2: 8. Drivers may legally block an intersection:
column4: only after entering the intersection on a green light.
column6: under no circumstances.

column2: 9. In case of skidding, drivers should NOT:
column4: tap the gas pedal with their foot.
column6: pump the brakes gently if they are about to hit something.
column8: take their foot off the gas pedal.

column2: 10. What do warning signs mean?
column6: Drivers are approaching a location where there is a special rule.

column2: 11. This road sign means:
column6: Construction zone

column2: 12. Drivers should be aware that a motorcyclist may:
column4: decrease speed and rise off the seat when approaching a railroad crossing.
column6: quickly change speed or lane position.

column2: 13. If the vehicle is equipped with air bags, seat belts:
column6: should still be worn.

column2: 14. This sign means:
column6: Left turns are not allowed at the intersection.
column8: The road will curve to the right.

column2: 15. This road sign means:
column6: Work work ahead

column2: 16. Aggressive driving includes:
column6: chasing or challenging other drivers.
column8: quick lane changes without a signal.

column2: 17. Drivers who have been drinking are more likely to:
column6: yield right-of-way to oncoming vehicles.

column2: 18. Drivers have to yield to pedestrians:
column4: only if the pedestrians have a green light.
column6: even if the pedestrian is not obeying traffic controls.
column8: only when the pedestrian is in the crosswalk.

column2: 19. This road sign means:
column6: Pedestrian crossing ahead

column2: 20. When passing another car, you have enough room to return to the driving lane when:
column4: you can see both headlights of the car you passed in your rearview mirror.
column6: you are at least 50 feet in front of the vehicle.
column8: you cannot see the vehicle directly to your right.

column2: 21. This sign warns drivers that:
column6: there is a one lane bridge ahead.

column2: 22. When approaching an intersection with a traffic control signal that is not working, drivers should:
column4: stop as you would if there were stop signs in all directions, yield the right-of-way, then enter the intersection.
column6: try not to stop if the intersection is clear.
column8: speed up and proceed through the intersection.

column2: 23. This road sign means:
column6: Minimum Speed
column8: Traffic must move only in the direction of the arrow

column2: 24. If you are feeling tired while driving, you should:
column6: stop and get some rest.

column2: 25. When following motorcycles, drivers should:
column4: try to pass them as they have different braking capabilities than other motor vehicles.
column6: keep more space in front of their vehicle.

column2: 26. You want to turn left at an intersection ahead. A car reaches the intersection from the opposite direction and moves straight ahead. You:
column4: can turn left. You have the right of way.
column6: may not enter the intersection to prepare for your left turn if the light is green.
column8: must wait for the car to go through before you turn.

column2: 27. Motorcycles:
column4: are entitled to use a complete traffic lane.
column6: must share a traffic lane with another vehicle.
column8: are easier to see than cars.

column2: 28. Left turns on a red light are allowed:
column4: from a one-way street into a one-way street.
column6: Never.
column8: at intersections, after stopping, if the way is clear.

column2: 29. Which signs have black letters on a yellow or orange background?
column6: Warning signs (diamond)

column2: 30. Only _____ can reduce the alcohol level in the blood.
column6: taking a cold shower

column2: 31. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: the road will make a sharp turn to the right.
column6: left turns are not allowed at the intersection.
column8: another road enters the highway from the direction shown.

column2: 32. _________________ your mirrors when you prepare to change lanes.
column6: Always rely on

column2: 33. When an aggressive driver confronts you, you should:
column6: Try to move away safely.

column2: 34. Driving at excessive speed:
column6: does not increase the chance of a crash.

column2: 35. If a vehicle is coming towards you at night with its high beams on, making it hard to see the road ahead, you should:
column4: look ahead towards the left edge of your lane.
column6: look ahead towards the right edge of your lane.
column8: look straight ahead towards the middle of the lane.

column2: 36. A red arrow on a traffic light means:
column4: You must stop and then proceed when the way is clear.
column6: You may turn in in the direction of the arrow after coming to a complete stop.
column8: You may not turn in the direction of the arrow until a green light or arrow light goes on.

column2: 37. When drivers see the ‘Wrong Way’ sign:
column4: they must not leave the pavement except in an emergency.
column6: they must drive past this sign and reach the next intersection.
column8: they are going the wrong way on an expressway exit ramp.

column2: 38. A driver who approaches an intersection:
column4: has the right-of-way over traffic already in the intersection.
column6: must drive straight through the intersection, even if another vehicle is already in the intersection.
column8: must yield the right-of-way to traffic already in the intersection.

column2: 39. Driving under the influence of any medication which impairs your driving ability is permitted:
column6: if you dont feel drowsy.
column8: if it is prescribed by a physician.

column2: 40. When driving in fog, drivers should use:
column6: parking lights.

column2: 41. Service signs are ____ with ____ letters and symbols.
column6: white; black

column2: 42. When daylight begins to fade, you should use your:
column6: emergency flashers.

column2: 43. The amount of alcohol in the blood is measured by:
column6: blood alcohol concentration (BAC).

column2: 44. Where must a pedestrian walk when there are no sidewalks?
column4: On the side of the road, facing the traffic.
column6: In the middle of the road, facing oncoming traffic.
column8: On the side of the road, in the same direction of traffic.

column2: 45. Vertical rectangles tell drivers:
column6: what is not allowed.

column2: 46. A curb painted red means:
column6: Reserved for passengers pick up or drop off
column8: Parking is for disabled persons with a special placard or plate.

column2: 47. After passing a vehicle, it is safe to return to your lane:
column6: when you can no longer see the vehicle over your right shoulder.
column8: when you see the front bumper of the other vehicle in your mirror.

column2: 48. The yield sign means:
column6: If the way is clear, you may move forward slowly without stopping.
column8: Go. The light will soon be red.

column2: 49. When taking medication while driving, you should:
column6: consult your physicians and/or pharmacist regarding any prescription medication and its possible effects on driving.
column8: drive 20 MPH below the posted speed limit.

column2: 50. This sign means:
column6: Drivers are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.
